etymologies: mid 19th century; earliest use found in Henry McMurtrie (1793–1865). From scientific Latin Physa, genus name from ancient Greek ϕῦσα bellows, probably from the same Indo-European base as classical Latin pustula

definitions: A small freshwater snail of the genus Physa or family Physidae, having a thin, sinistral shell; (in form Physa) the genus itself.
